synopsis.text:
Kyoto's Tale of Genji Museum presents an enchanting blend of history and fantasy in a short film, whisking viewers away on a journey alongside Hana, a contemporary high school student magically transformed into a feline. Hana is catapulted back in time, landing in the Heian Era, a period beautifully captured in the renowned Japanese literary masterpiece, The Tale of Genji.

Under the guidance of the captivating Hikaru Genji, the story's protagonist, Hana navigates the rich tapestry of emotions intricately woven by Murasaki Shikibu, the novel's author. The film offers a unique perspective, allowing Hana, and by extension the audience, to experience these emotions firsthand.

The short film also integrates scenes inspired by The Diary of Lady Murasaki and other historical records, such as the real-life noble Fujiwara no Michinaga's insatiable curiosity leading him to pilfer early drafts of The Tale of Genji, unable to contain his eagerness to read Murasaki's latest chapters. This fascinating blend of fact and fiction promises a captivating viewing experience, inviting audiences to delve deeper into the world of The Tale of Genji.
